chapter.title: Bi-directional text
chapter.para: &appshort; displays bi-directional text and provides several means for controlling how bi-directional text gets displayed.

A text label's primary direction gets determined based on the default Unicode bi-directional rendering algorithm. Use the &ns;::w::label_config's optional &ns;::w::bidi direction to explicitly override a label's rendering direction, when necessary.
Input fields' rendering direction gets specified the same way. Use &ns;::w::input_field_config's &ns;::w::bidi direction to explicitly override the input field's rendering direction.

section.title: Bi-directional text input
section.para: Input fields apply Unicode isolation and override markers, then display and edit the resulting bi-directional text, directly, with all isolation and override markers stripped off.

get() and get_unicode() use the &ns;::w::bidi_format directional_format that's specified in the &ns;::w::input_field_config, by default; or the optional &ns;::w::bidi_format parameter that overrides this default.
Input field search callback threads always receive a search_string in the standard &ns;::w::bidi_format.
